content.question: A kitten weighs 85 grams at birth. During the first four weeks after the kittenâ€™s birth, its weight in grams is given by the function <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> that satisfies the differential equation <math alttext="the derivative of W, with respect to t, equals, k W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in days and <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is some positive constant. Which of the following could be an expression for <math alttext="W of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="85 times, e raised to the 0.059, t power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>85</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0.059</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="4 times, e raised to the 0.162, t power, plus 81" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0.162</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>81</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="0.466 times, t squared, plus 85" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.466</mn><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>85</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="85 times, e raised to the 0.059, t power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>85</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0.059</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 3.G: Confirm that solutions are accurate and appropriate.
